Inkpress

Using inkscape to build the big graph of impress.js

View the Project on GitHub yarray/inkpress

  • Download ZIP File
  • Download TAR Ball
  • View On GitHub

Demo

The svg used in demo:

With "Trace" layer:

The result presentation is here

To see the effect more clearly, see the presentation with "Trace" shown here

The html code of the demo page is here:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<title></title>
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes" />
<meta name="viewport" content="width=1280" />
<link rel="stylesheet" href="stylesheets/inkpress.css" 
     type="text/css" media="screen" charset="utf-8">
</head>
<body>
<div id="impress">
    <!--pre exist steps will be preserved, -->
    <!-- id should be step-{trace rect id} -->
    <div class="step" id="step-3">
        <h1>Hello World</h1>
    </div>
</div>
<script src="javascripts/lib/impress.js"></script>
<script src="javascripts/lib/jquery-2.0.3.min.js"></script>
<script src="javascripts/inkpress.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
$(function() { 
    inkpress.init('demo.svg', {
        width: 1280,
        height: 800
    });
})
</script>
</body>
</html>

This project is maintained by yarray
